abstract: "I am fully committed to moving the smart card program forward," Joseph J. Lhota, the transportation authority's new chairman, said.
lead_paragraph: It was a marquee proposal by Jay H. Walder, chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority during the relatively flush times of 2009: Replace the MetroCard with a computer chip-enabled "smart card" that would speed up boarding times and save the agency millions of dollars a year.

headline.main: Upon Reflection, New M.T.A. Chief Says He Likes 'Smart Cards' for the Subway
